title: Sturm vs Atalanta match facts | UEFA Europa League
body_text:
Sturm vs Atalanta match facts
Thursday, October 12, 2023
Article body
Group D table-toppers Atalanta face a second consecutive away match as they travel to Austria to take on Sturm Graz on Matchday 3 in the UEFA Europa League.
Sturm picked up their first win of the campaign on Matchday 2, a 24th-minute goal from William Bøving enough to secure a 1-0 win at competition debutants Raków Częstochowa.
Meanwhile, Atalanta made it two wins from two with a 2-1 away victory at Sporting Clube de Portugal thanks to first-half goals from Giorgio Scalvini (33) and Matteo Ruggeri (43).
This will be a first meeting between the sides in UEFA competition.
Form guide
Sturm Graz
Record vs Italian clubs: W1 D5 L6 F11 A18
Home record vs Italian clubs: W0 D3 L3
Sturm Graz are without a win in their six previous home matches against Italian opposition, drawing three and losing three.
Their only victory against an Italian team came in a UEFA Cup third round second leg in 2002/03, when a 1-0 away win at Lazio was not enough to turn round a 3-1 home loss in the first leg.
The Austrian side faced Lazio again in last season's Europa League group stage, exchanging two draws (0-0 h, 2-2 a) with Bøving scoring twice in Rome.
Sturm are in the group stage of the Europa League for the fifth time but have finished bottom of their section in each of their last four appearances.
The three-time Austrian champions were runners-up to Salzburg for the second season in a row in 2022/23, qualifying for the Champions League third qualifying round. However, a 7-2 aggregate defeat by PSV Eindhoven (1-4 a, 1-3 h) sent them into the Europa League group stage.
The victory at Raków last time out was only Sturm's third in their last 18 matches in European competition (D4 L11).
Atalanta
This will be Atalanta's first meeting against a team from Austria in UEFA competition.
Last season was Atalanta's first without European football in five years after they had finished eighth in Serie A in 2021/22. However, they are now returning for just their second appearance in the Europa League group stage after ending the 2022/23 campaign fifth in the Italian top flight.
Atalanta's previous Europa League appearance, two seasons ago, took them as far as the quarter-finals after they had transferred from the UEFA Champions League group stage. Victories in the knockout play-off round against Olympiacos (2-1 h, 3-0 a) and the round of 16 against Bayer Leverkusen (3-2 h, 1-0 a) set up a last-eight game against Leipzig but, after a 1-1 first-leg draw in Germany, two Christopher Nkunku goals in Bergamo ended the Italian side's hopes.
La Dea's only previous Europa League group stage appearance was in 2017/18 when they topped their section in convincing fashion, winning four and drawing two of their six games, including a 5-1 win against Everton at Goodison Park. However, their run was cut short in the round of 32 by Borussia Dortmund (2-3 a, 1-1 h).
Atalanta ended the following season's Europa League in the second qualifying round, beating Sarajevo 10-2 on aggregate and defeating Hapoel Haifa 6-1 in the third qualifying round before losing 4-2 on penalties to Copenhagen after two goalless draws in the qualifying play-offs.
Having not won any of their first seven games away from home in Europe (D2 L5), Atalanta have lost just two of their last 14 on the road (W7 D5).
Links and trivia
Has played in Italy:
David Schnegg (Venezia 2021/22, Crotone 2022 loan)
Atalanta's Emil Holm scored his first international goal for Sweden on 12 September in a 3-1 defeat against Austria.
International team-mates:
Amadou Dante and El Bilal Touré (Mali)
Jusuf Gazibegović & Sead Kolašinac (Bosnia and Herzegovina)
Gregory Wüthrich & Berat Djimsiti (Switzerland youth)
Kjell Scherpen & Mitchel Bakker (Netherlands youth)
